section.para: When using pico-vfs, there are several limitations and behavior specifics that users should be aware of. These limitations are particularly important when performing multicore operations.

section.title: File System Limitations

listitem.para: Multiple Open Instances: The current implementations of littlefs and FatFs do not support opening the same file multiple times simultaneously[^1][^2]. This limitation can affect scenarios where multiple accesses to the same file are required concurrently.
Access to on-board flash from core1: When operating file systems using the onboard flash block device on core1, it is necessary to run the operations from RAM[^3].
Access on-board flash in FreeRTOS: To access the flash device, the firmware must be stored in RAM or run with #define configNUMBER_OF_CORES 1.
Memory maped IO: mmap system call not supported.

Max File Size for FAT: The maximum single file size of a FAT file system depends on the capacity of the storage medium. Check the size of the SD card used and the type of FAT (FAT16/32/ExFat) automatically assigned.

section.para: We recommend reviewing these limitations before designing systems that heavily rely on multicore operations or require high file access availability.
